p: Use of 0.5 % Virkon S and 2.06 % Clorox that reduced the quantity of PEDV RNA were the best disinfectants for PEDV inactivation in feces ( Bowman et al., 2015b). Super-oxidized water (pH 6.0) also effectively inactivated PEDV at room temperature after 10−90 min contact ( Chen et al., 2017). Washing trailers with a high pressure power washer, followed by disinfection and drying, was effective for their sanitation and decontamination ( Baker et al., 2018; Thomas et al., 2015b). Accelerated hydrogen peroxide or peroxygen-based disinfectants effectively inactivated PEDV on contaminated metal (trailer) surfaces at 20 °C after 30 min contact ( Holtkamp et al., 2017) and at −10 °C after 40−60 min contact ( Baker et al., 2017), or at -10 to 4 °C after 10−30 min contact ( Baker et al., 2018), respectively. PEDV RNA was still detectable after disinfection, but no infectious virus was detected.
